course.title: Broadway Musicals: History and Performance
course.description: This seminar explores a core group of Broadway musicals, fusing classroom study and hands-on creativity. Historical and musical discussions will be paired with student performances and staging of individual scenes (under the guidance of the A.R.T. Institute). The seminar touches on signal moments in the "Golden Age" of the musical, and it involves a collaboration with A.R.T.'s "Civil War" series, including a new opera by Matt Aucoin ('12).
course.notes: Open to Freshmen only. Student musicians and actors are welcome in the course, as are students who love to watch shows but not necessarily perform in them. Ability to read music is desirable but not required.
